title: Georges Seurat Final Study for “Bathers at Asnières” Scarf
description:
Scarf developed from Georges Seurat’s Final Study for "Bathers at Asnières", 1883, from The Art Institute of Chicago’s collection.

The view presented here is just across the river from the leisure park Seurat immortalized in his best-known work, A Sunday on La Grande Jatte—1884. Seurat’s focus on a subject from modern life, his luminous palette, and his airy brushwork show how the young artist adapted characteristics of Impressionist painting for his own purposes.

  • Dimensions: 32 x 55 in.
  • Material: Polyester
  • Hand wash, hang dry.
